title: 2025 LLM Year in Review: Claude Code as First True AI Agent
description: Andrej Karpathy identifies Claude Code (CC) as 'the first convincing demonstration of what an LLM Agent looks like.' He describes it as an agent that iteratively uses tools in a loopy way and lives on your computer, showing the potential of AI agents for productivity, though fully automated engineers haven't arrived yet.
author: Andrej Karpathy

title: LLM Year in Review - Hacker News Discussion
description: Hacker News users discuss Andrej Karpathy's LLM Year in Review, with many noting that Claude Code was 'the most impressive innovation this year' and Cursor being 'a good proof of concept but Claude Code is the tool that...' delivered on the promise.
author: Hacker News Community

title: 3 Techniques to Effectively Utilize AI Agents for Coding
description: Towards Data Science article exploring practical techniques for leveraging AI coding agents, discussing how AI agents have revolutionized programming and providing actionable strategies for developers.
author: Towards Data Science

title: AI coding is now everywhere. But not everyone is convinced.
description: MIT Technology Review analysis of the current state of AI coding tools, examining the productivity benefits versus developer concerns about AI-powered coding assistants in 2025.
author: MIT Technology Review
